title: Tips for getting started at home

---


Think first about the benefits of your yoga!&nbsp; And just do it as they say:

* Gain flexibility and mobility throughout the entire body.
* Gain strength and tone your muscles.
* Learn to breathe deeply (we rarely practice this day-to-day).
* Help manage your stress levels.
* Release tension â€“ physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual.
* Let go of the old and welcome in the new for 2018.

Key tips:

Aim for short regular sessions on as many days as you can (15-20 mins say)

Pick a time (before breakfast, or as soon as you come in after work) and keep to it

Leave your mat in a quiet place where you can practice

Use music if you like, make it as enjoyable as possible.

What to do:

I suggest starting with some standing warm ups in this colder weather.

* The four part twist/forward and backward steps/squats/ moving warrior 1
* The four part leg raises: inhale knee and arms up/exhale knee out/ up/&nbsp; both down
* Child/cat/dog moves on your mat
* Some work for the core/abdominals (eg leg raises)
* Backbends on your tummy
* Rest in child -&nbsp; then a few minutes to relax, or add in some more postures.

The wall can be used too, see the sketches below to remind you of this week's class.
